snippet: A new report found that by reducing the number of full-time workers over a decade, the health care law will have a liberating impact for millions.
abstract: Editorial applauds Congressional Budget Office estimates showing that Affordable Care Act will reduce number of full-time workers by 2.5 million over decade by making health insurance more affordable; says report highlights choices workers can make when they are no longer tethered to employer for health benefits.
lead_paragraph: A new report found that by reducing the number of full-time workers over a decade, the health care law will have a liberating impact for millions.

headline.main: Freeing Workers From the Insurance Trap
headline.print_headline: Freeing Workers From the Insurance Trap

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
